events.name: Ministry of Science Live!
events.desc_short: Ministry of Science Live is not your ordinary science show – it comes with a bang. It comes with a whoosh. But most of all it comes with a Hovercraft built on stage.
events.desc_full:
WARNING. WARNING. This is a public safety announcement… Please keep your head firmly on your shoulders and your arms, legs and feet firmly inside the ride at all times – Ministry of Science Live is about to explode onto a stage near you soon! Ministry of Science Live is not your ordinary science show – it comes with a bang. It comes with a whoosh. But most of all it comes with a Hovercraft built on stage.

From liquid nitrogen frozen flowers to hydrogen bottle rockets fired right at you the show will take you on a journey using demonstrations and a few loud bangs to lead the way. From the creative team behind Brainiac Live, Guinness World Records Officially Amazing Science Live and a whole load of other educational shows with an anarchic twist – Ministry of Science Live is not to be missed….

Ministry of Science is supported by Seagate and ILEX

events.name: 1,000 Digital Champions - Schools Edition
events.desc_short: Across the week of CultureTECH we'll be working with around 1,500 young people to help them get involved in our 1,000 Digital Champions campaign.
events.desc_full:
Across the week of CultureTECH we'll be working with around 1,500 young people to help them get involved in our 1,000 Digital Champions campaign.

The campaign has been developed in support of the Go ON NI initiative which seeks to address the lack of digital skills across Northern Ireland. Digital champions volunteer their time to share their online skills with friends, family, colleagues and neighbours - helping thousands more people get online in the process.

These sessions are made possible through the generous support of Seagate and Arts & Business NI

events.name: The Starry Messenger: Seven Artist Filmmakers
events.desc_short: Void brings together work by seven contemporary artist filmmakers that signal the value of what is held within film as a medium
events.desc_full:
Should we describe today the art and technology of celluloid filmmaking as a redundant technology or an extinct artform ?

Across the spectrum, from high end commercial film to emerging filmmakers and film schools, moving image media are ever more exclusively digital both in production and screening. Film labs, seemingly no-longer commercially viable, are closing and the survival of analogue film-making has come to resemble a campaign for a critically endangered species, as filmmakers, artists, and critics across the world have had to come together to campaign for institutional support to safeguard the ability to manufacture, shoot, process, print, make and project film. The campaign savefilm.org is approaching national and international organisations to take active steps to protect the medium of film, and is requesting that UNESCO recognise film, the practice of filmmaking and film projection as world cultural heritage.

As part of this discussion, in summer 2014 Void brings together work by seven contemporary artist filmmakers that signal the value of what is held within film as a medium, what is visible and invisible in celluloid, its physics and chemistry, its emulsion and grain and lights and darks, and its place as a language and medium in our collective memories.

events.name: Crows on the Wire App Launch
events.desc_short: An innovative interactive graphic novel from the original drama by Jonathan Burgess adapted for comics by Black North
events.desc_full:
AN INNOVATIVE INTERACTIVE GRAPHIC NOVEL FROM THE ORIGINAL DRAMA BY JONATHAN BURGESS

ADAPTED FOR COMICS BY BLACK NORTH

With additional educational material by Dr Alan McMurray.

Verbal Arts Centre will be joined by vibrant digital media company Black North to present the most innovative and stimulating educational resource created to date for iPads and tablets. This beautifully illustrated comic is a ground breaking educational tool for teachers of Citizenship and History.

The story explores the subject of policing, and is set on the night of the transition from the RUC to PSNI. The story is set in the police locker room, which you can visit in 3D using the amazing Oculus Rift.

Immerse yourself in the Crows on the Wire experience using the Oculus Rift in the company of Black North at the Verbal Arts Centre on Monday 15th September from 10am-3pm.

This project is funded under the EU’s PEACE III Programme, managed for the SEUPB by Pobal.

events.name: Honeycomb - Creative Works Bootcamp
events.desc_short: Twenty winners of the Honeycomb Creative Buzz Award take part in a four-day intensive mentoring and networking experience to kickstart their digital careers.
events.desc_full:
This is an invitation-only event for the digital creators of tomorrow.

Twenty winners of the Honeycomb Creative Buzz Award take part in a four-day intensive mentoring and networking experience to kickstart their digital careers.

events.name: Magic Touch
events.desc_short: Magic Touch is an exhibition that features work by Kate Davis, Jessie Flood-Paddock, Katja Novitskova, Padraig Spillane and Artie Vierkant
events.desc_full:
Magic Touch is an exhibition that features work by Kate Davis, Jessie Flood-Paddock, Katja Novitskova, Padraig Spillane and Artie Vierkant – five contemporary artists who respond to the way that objects and technologies carry the imprint of the human body.

The exhibition considers our changing relationships to objects, presenting works such as Kate Davis’s video installation Denkmal (2013) that narrates the touch of common objects that recent technology has made redundant; or Katja Novitskova’s series sculptural works Shapeshifters (2013-14) that appear like primitive weapons, made from hand-pressed epoxy clay, nail polish and broken computer wafers.

Magic Touch has been developed through the recognition of contemporary displacements of the human body. This is a displacement caused by the new technologies of our inter-connected ‘touch-screen’ world, and another kind of displacement that follows recent ‘object-orientated’ and ‘post-humanist’ philosophies that have undermined notions of human empowerment over things. As such, Magic Touch considers how the human body continues to imprint itself in new ways upon the objects and technologies that at first appear to dispel it on physical and metaphysical terms.

events.name: See Tech
events.desc_short: See Tech offers a look at the accessibility features on everyday digital technology to make the screen bigger, clearer and easier to see
events.desc_full:
In conjunction with RNIB, See Tech offers a look at the accessibility features on everyday digital technology to make the screen bigger, clearer and easier to see. Devices include tablets, phones and ebook readers.

Come along and see how digital technology can help you, what's new to the market, and how you can benefit from accessing the built in features that will make it easier to read and use your devices.

Even if you feel a little strain when reading, this casual event may help you access elements in technology that you didn't know could help.

events.name: Women Who Code: Tech Teamwork
events.desc_short: WWC UK's "Tech Teamwork" event aims to showcase the fantastic careers the IT industry has to offer, whilst giving them an insight into some of the ways they can get into coding.
events.desc_full:
Women Who Code is a worldwide non-profit organisation, with over 12,000 members in 14 countries that aims to help women excel in tech careers. We work on eradicating the gender bias in the tech industry through free monthly hack nights, tech talks and career trainings.

Women Who Code UK (which began in Belfast, and now spans mainland UK) works on tailoring what the women in each local haven need. We are very happy to be a part of CultureTech, where we will bring the tech industry to young girls.

In 2013, 245 girls vs 3513 boys chose A Level computing. Think about how many amazing young female entreprenuers we all could have missed out on.

WWC UK's "Tech Teamwork" event aims to showcase the fantastic careers the IT industry has to offer, whilst giving them an insight into some of the ways they can get into coding.

events.name: Film Hub NI Launch: SciFi: Days of Fear and Wonder
events.desc_short: Film Hub NI are hosting a free lunchtime screening of  Invasion of the Body Snatchers. Refreshments will be provided.
events.desc_full:
Welcome reception and screening of Invasion of the Body Snatchers (1956)

It’s landing…The BFI’s Sci-Fi: Days of Fear and Wonder season of wonderfully weird, entertaining, scary and sometimes downright comical film screenings and events is coming to a venue near you from September to December 2014.

The season will include over 1000 screenings of classic film and television programmes at over 200 locations across the UK, from outdoor events at iconic British sites to screenings in multiplexes, local cinemas and community venues.

Join the fun (costume optional) with Film Hub NI’s members Black Box, Nerve Centre, Dungannon Film Club, Filmgoer, Cinemagic, Takeover Film Festival, Strand Arts Centre, Belfast Film Festival, Outburst Arts and QFT as they take you through unexplored territory to a world of aliens, time travel, parallel universes and much more.

To launch this season, Film Hub NI are hosting a free lunchtime screening of Invasion of the Body Snatchers. Refreshments will be provided. Tickets are limited and allocated on a first come first served basis - please book by emailing filmhubni@qub.ac.uk

Further info

Film Hub NI is part of a significant new national initiative aimed at growing audiences for film across the UK. Running until March 2017, the British Film Institute (BFI) Film Audience Network (FAN) aims to put film at the centre of cultural life in Northern Ireland and the rest of the UK, encouraging more people to see a more diverse range of films in more locations nationally. Film Hub NI is managed and delivered by Queen’s Film Theatre

The British Film Institute have provided Film Hub NI with funding to support members in a wide range of screenings and events celebrating the Sci-Fi film genre, branded as Sci-Fi: Days of Fear and Wonder.

rsvp.instructions: Tickets are limited and allocated on a first come first served basis - please book by emailing filmhubni@qub.ac.uk

events.name: Watify Networking Event
events.desc_short: Join us for the first Industry Event of the week and also meet a few of your fellow festival goers at an informal reception hosted by WATIFY and NORIBIC.
events.desc_full:
Join us for the first Industry Event of the week and also meet a few of your fellow festival goers at an informal reception hosted by WATIFY and NORIBIC.

WATIFY, funded by the European Commission, and managed by Deloitte Belgium, DIGITALEUROPE and EBN, is a campaign that has been launched across Europe aiming to raise awareness and support students, entrepreneurs/intrapreneurs and existing businesses to foster digital entrepreneurship.

The main challenge facing entrepreneurs in Europe is not the lack of great ideas but the fear of turning ideas into reality. Many people with great ideas are reluctant to embrace entrepreneurship because of their doubts. There are as many people wanting to start a business in Europe as there are in the USA, yet we see a significantly lower level of involvement in start-ups on this side of the Atlantic. Only 6% of the adult population of Europe is engaged in a new business, compared with 13% in the USA. That’s why the European Commission has launched the Watify platform. Its ambition is to promote digital entrepreneurship by addressing these doubts, accelerating creation of up to 1.5 million jobs and unlocking the 98% unexploited potential of value creation by going digital.

Show your support for Digital Entreprenuership and Digital Transformation of existing businesses across Europe by attending the WATIFY Launch in Northern Ireland!

Here's the lineup:

17:00 Drinks Reception, Music & Networking with fellow festival goers
17:30 Introduction to WATIFY
17:35 Panel Discussion: Stimulating digital entrepreneurship & transforming businesses: the challenges today
Moderator: TBC

Speakers
Michael Faulkner, CEO at SeedUps / CoFunder
Kevin Logue, Managing Director, Uproar Comics
Greg O'Hanlon, Managing Partner, Non Zero Sum
18:10 Q& A session
18:30 Networking Drinks
19:00 Close

events.name: Becoming Martian
events.desc_short: Join Australian physicist, comedian & astronaut candidate Josh Richards on an humorous and informative journey to the red planet
events.desc_full:
Join Australian physicist, comedian & astronaut candidate Josh Richards on an humorous and informative journey to the red planet, looking at how colonising Mars will change humans in body, mind and soul.

Short-listed as a candidate to Mars One's 2024 mission to send humans one-way to Mars, and taken from his upcoming book "Becoming Martian", Josh blends science, engineering and ethics with comedy as he shares how colonising Mars will change us as a species.

How will our bodies adapt to life in 38% gravity? How will having no hope of return to Earth affect the colonist's minds, and how will becoming a dual-planet species forever change how we see the universe?

This event is free but a charitable donation of £5 to Children in Crossfire would be most welcome.

rsvp.instructions: RSVP Online at getinvited.to/culturetech/becoming-martian  This event is free but a charitable donation of £5 to Children in Crossfire would be most welcome.
